definitions.text: abstain from certain foods, as for religious or medical reasons

examples: Before the medical exam, you must fast

definitions.text: acting or moving or capable of acting or moving quickly
examples: on the fast track in school

definitions.text: (used of timepieces) indicating a time ahead of or later than the correct time

examples: the band played a fast fox trot
grass courts are faster than clay
Congreve draws a debauched aristocratic society
took a flying glance at the book
the post was still firm after being hit by the car

definitions.text: unwavering in devotion to friend or vow or cause; ; ; - Campaign song for William Henry Harrison
(of a photographic lens or emulsion) causing a shortening of exposure time
quickly or rapidly (often used as a combining form)
examples: how fast can he get here?
ran as fast as he could
